ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Slowdown in LinkScoper?
ygData.msgSnippet: Followup: This seems to be progressive.  I launched a new crawl (same order.xml, different seeds), and while I m seeing LinkScoper processors running for 7-10

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Slowdown in LinkScoper?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=230697592; y=KQ49S_MzdjvHQ26PchORRRSyPcNMS91tfe8snAs-_9NAxA
X-Yahoo-Profile: ryanatl

Followup:

This seems to be progressive.  I launched a new crawl (same order.xml, 
different seeds), and while I'm
seeing LinkScoper processors running for 7-10 seconds (still seems 
long), that's about the extent of it.
Actually, at the start of the crawl, the majority of threads seem to 
spend most
of their time in processor HTTP.  Using the DomainSensitiveFrontier.

ryanatl wrote:

> Using Head: 1.5.0-200507251046
>
> ToeThreadReport (slightly edited to just show times):
>
> Check Thread #5 and #6, active for + 6m and + 3m.  These times don't
> seem to be cumulative for the duration of the run.  Also using the
> count-per-domain feature with a limit of 500 pages per domain.  Seems
> like the majority of threads are spending the majority of their time
> in LinkScoper?
>
